    "Step 2: For each green column with a filled Date/Event/Guidance Period (FY 2025: columns C–F; FY 2024: columns G–J; FY 2023: columns K–N), located the matching ADT earnings release on ADT Investor Relations / Newsroom and extracted the full-year guidance ranges shown in the 'Financial Outlook' / 'Guidance' tables for Total Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA, Adjusted EPS, and Adjusted Free Cash Flow (including swaps).",
    "Step 3: Entered only hardcoded numeric Low/High values (Revenue/EBITDA/FCF in $mm; EPS in $/share) into the green cells and formatted all entered numbers in blue font. Left cells blank where ADT did not provide that metric (e.g., no Adj. EPS provided in the FY 2023 initial outlook at 4Q22)."

reasoning_steps: Step 1: Opened the provided input.xlsx and identified the green-highlighted input cells on the 'Guidance' sheet (rows 9/10 Revenue, 14/15 Adj. EBITDA, 20/21 Adj. EPS, 25/26 FCF) and the corresponding guidance columns/dates in row 3.

Step 2: For each green column with a filled Date/Event/Guidance Period (FY 2025: columns C–F; FY 2024: columns G–J; FY 2023: columns K–N), located the matching ADT earnings release on ADT Investor Relations / Newsroom and extracted the full-year guidance ranges shown in the 'Financial Outlook' / 'Guidance' tables for Total Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA, Adjusted EPS, and Adjusted Free Cash Flow (including swaps).

Step 3: Entered only hardcoded numeric Low/High values (Revenue/EBITDA/FCF in $mm; EPS in $/share) into the green cells and formatted all entered numbers in blue font. Left cells blank where ADT did not provide that metric (e.g., no Adj. EPS provided in the FY 2023 initial outlook at 4Q22).
